Class Time

  • java.lang.Object
    • hw1.Time

  • public class Time
extends java.lang.Object
    Time implements handling of time instances
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Seth Shelnutt

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Time(int day, int hour, int min, int sec)
      Initializes a instance of Time with given parameters.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Time add(Time time)
      Add a given time instance to current time instance.
      int get_total_Days()
      Returns the total number of days In this case total days will be the same as getdays()
      int get_total_Hours()
      Returns the total number of hours in the Time instance Differs from getHours, by converting all units to hours
      int get_total_Minutes()
      Returns the total number of minutes in the Time instance Differs from getMinutes, by converting all units to minutes
      int get_total_Seconds()
      Returns the total number of seconds in the Time instance Differs from getSeconds, by converting all units to seconds
      int getDays()
      returns days from Time instance
      int getHours()
      returns hours from Time instance
      int getMinutes()
      returns minutes from Time instance
      int getSeconds()
      returns seconds from Time instance
      java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Object> isNegative()
      Check if time is negative and if so returns and arraylist with new time and boolean saying true.
      Time subtract(Time time)
      Subtract a given time instance from current time instance.
      java.lang.String toString()

    • Constructor Detail

      • Time

        public Time(int day,
    int hour,
    int min,
    int sec)
        Initializes a instance of Time with given parameters. Automatically handles cases were units roll over.
        Parameters:
        day - Input number of days
        hour - Input number of hours
        min - Input number of minutes
        sec - Input number of seconds

        public java.lang.String toString()

        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:

      • get_total_Days

        public int get_total_Days()
        Returns the total number of days In this case total days will be the same as getdays()
        Returns:
        Number of days as an integer.

      • get_total_Hours

        public int get_total_Hours()
        Returns the total number of hours in the Time instance Differs from getHours, by converting all units to hours
        Returns:
        total hours as an integer.

      • get_total_Minutes

        public int get_total_Minutes()
        Returns the total number of minutes in the Time instance Differs from getMinutes, by converting all units to minutes
        Returns:
        total minutes as an integer

      • get_total_Seconds

        public int get_total_Seconds()
        Returns the total number of seconds in the Time instance Differs from getSeconds, by converting all units to seconds
        Returns:
        total second as an integer

      • isNegative

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Object> isNegative()
        Check if time is negative and if so returns and arraylist with new time and boolean saying true.
        Returns:
        Arraylist with boolean of true if negative and new instance of time class with time that is positive.

      • add

        public Time add(Time time)
        Add a given time instance to current time instance.
        Parameters:
        time - Takes input of time to be added to current time instance
        Returns:
        New instance of time class with time addition

      • subtract

        public Time subtract(Time time)
        Subtract a given time instance from current time instance.
        Parameters:
        time - Takes input of time to be subtracted from the current time instance
        Returns:
        New instance of time class with time subtracted
